title: Input Symbol for Latin Small Letters

adjectives: Relating to languages derived from Latin
Of or pertaining to peoples who use languages derived from Latin.
Of or dealing with languages or cultures derived from Roman influence and Latin.
Of or dealing with languages or cultures derived from Roman influence and Latin: Italian, French, Portuguese, Spanish, Romanian, Catalan, Occitan, Corsican, etc.
Relating to the process of education
Relating to small (not capitalized) letters that were kept in the lower half of a compositor's type case
verbs: To enter data into a system.
Enter (data or a program) into a computer
To acquire knowledge on a subject.
To acquire, or attempt to acquire knowledge or an ability to do something.
To designate by the letters of the alphabet; to arrange alphabetically.
Orally recite the letters of or give the spelling of "We had to spell out our names for the police officer"
To write or say the letters that form a word or part of a word.
nouns: Occurring in a scientific description
Latin is an ancient Italic language originally spoken by the Italic Latins in Latium and Ancient Rome.
Indo-European language of the Italic family
Any dialect of the language of ancient Rome

An Indo-European language originally spoken only in the region immediately surrounding the city of Rome, later throughout the Roman Empire, and as a result of the Roman legacy, by the Catholic and academic world in the Middle Ages and afterwards.
Language of the ancient Romans.
The language of the ancient Romans, other Latins and of the Roman Catholic church, especially Classical Latin.
A standardized set of letters, or metaphorically the fundamentals of any subject (e.g. "the ABC of finance")
An alphabet is a standard set of letters which is used to write one or more languages based on the general principle that the letters represent phonemes of the spoken language.
An ordered set of letters used in a language.
Standard set of letters
The set of letters used when writing in a language.
The elementary stages of any subject (usually plural)
A programming language and environment
ABC is an imperative general-purpose programming language and programming environment developed at CWI, Netherlands by Leo Geurts, Lambert Meertens, and Steven Pemberton.
A complete standardized set of letters each of which roughly represents a phoneme of a spoken language.
A resource used in the production of goods and services
In economics, factors of production, resources, or inputs are what is utilized in the production process in order to produce output -- that is, finished goods.
Something fed into a process with the intention of it shaping or affecting the outputs of that process.
A resource used to produce goods and services, such as labor, land, or capital.
The process of inputting information.
A user that performs a service, or the equipment or facility that is required for a service.
Something fed into a process.
A stock of money, product, or people services used in the performance of an activity.
The characters that were once kept in bottom half of a compositor's type case
Lower case letters, collectively.
The distinction between majuscule (uppercase) and minuscule (lowercase) letters.
In orthography and typography, letter case is the distinction between the letters that are in larger upper case and smaller lower case in certain languages.
The small letters in type, as distinguished from capital, uppercase, letters.
The distinction between upper and lowercase letters in typography
The minuscule or small letters (a, b, c, as opposed to the uppercase or capital letters, A, B, C).
Distinction between the letters that are in larger upper case and smaller lower case letters

description: A symbol showing the lowercase letters a, b, c and d. Intended to be used on a software keyboard, or other input screenÂ toÂ toggle lowercaseÂ letter input.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the 'input latin lowercase' emoji is a clean, crisp representation of the letter 'a' presented in a classic, lowercase sans-serif font, reflecting Apple's commitment to clear and readable typography. Its design features subtle, soft gradients and a gentle 3D effect, giving it a smooth, tactile feel without being overly complex, a hallmark of Apple's design language. This emoji signifies the act of typing, writing, or inputting text, particularly in a casual or informal context, a fundamental tool for digital communication rendered with Apple's signature elegance.
